Dark Vision.brief: You can see in perfect dark.
Dark Vision.verbose: You can see even in perfect darkness.

Land on your feet.brief: You don't suffer fall damage before 40 feet.
Land on your feet.verbose: You can fall 40 feet before taking fall damage.

Predator.verbose: When tracking, you have advantage on perception checks.

Loose Skin.verbose: You have advantage when breaking grapples.

They're Retractable.verbose: You have retractable, razor sharp claws capable of doing 1d4 damage.

Fear of Water.verbose: You have disadvantage when soaked through.

Catterwol.quote: Ah, yes, well... It was then that we stumbled upon an encampment of cat-folk. They seemed a nice enough sort, so we bought some of their wares, beads and knives and potions, that sort of thing. After that, we supped with them. Well, before we knew it, we were all unconcious; they drugged the food, no doubt. They made off with everything; my staff, my hat, and even my sandles!
Catterwol.author: Archibold, the Wizard
Catterwol.description: Catterwol are among the most lithe and dexterous of the races, and are adept at passign unseen and unheard. With padded feet and strong claws for climing, more than one Catterwol has turned to the life of a sneak-theif. Catterwol hail from dense, thicketed jungles and dry, dusty deserts. They make average mages, but prefer slim, dexterity based weapons.

subsections.text: Stalking on padded feet, the Catterwol Rouge makes her way carefully across the rooves of the city of Linth. Her target is simple, information and nothing more. Unfortunately, the information that she needs is buried inside of a chest locked in the room of Lord Edmire himself. Far below, her party waits with baited breath, as she hops from roof to roof, and then slips into Edmire's quarters. *Roll a Stealth Check!*

Needlelike teeth show in a sharp smile as the Catterwol Bard steps forward. "Hold on, surely we can work something out?" Isak, the kingpin of the city's thieves' guild, scoffs. "Not this time." From the corner of his eye, the Bard just notices two shadowy figures slip into view. His smile grows, and with a flash, he whips around and slings a throwing knife at one of the figures. *Roll for initiative!*
Cattterwol tend to live in loose, nomadic tribes. As a general rule, they are deeply distrustful of outsiders, and are known to act in their own self-interest more often than not.

When building your Catterwol, consider how they came to belong to your party. Remember that, while Catterwol are tribal, they are deeply protective of those close to them. Is the party their family now? What members of the party is your character close to?

Sleepless.brief: You can rest without sleeping for 1 day.
Sleepless.verbose: Your can rest without sleeping for one day, allowing you to keep watch long into the night.

Low-Light Vision.brief: You can see in low light.
Low-Light Vision.verbose: You can see in low light.

Winged Feet.verbose: You have advantage on acrobatics checks.

Tracker.verbose: You are an excellent tracker, and have advantage when looking for trails and sign of passage.

Counter Attack.brief: Reaction. Counterattack when an enemy attacks you.
Counter Attack.verbose: Reaction. You may strike back when an enemy attacks you.

Wood Elf.quote: Elves can be slippery folk. It seems to me that rarely say what they mean, and they seldom mean what they say. They're strong mages, though, and too clever for their own good. If you're dealing with elves, try to appeal to their pride, but be careful about it. They can see through simple flattery.
Wood Elf.author: Ser Gillthunder, Human Knight, Leader of the Hetzer Company (Mercenaries)
Wood Elf.description: Elves are the most magical of the races. Forest-dwellers with long lives, many elves spend their days practicing magic and honing their skills. Elves are naturally beautiful, and this beauty benefits them when they deal with the other races. Elves make strong mages and good dexterity based fighters.

Sleepless.brief: You can rest without sleeping for 1 day.
Sleepless.verbose: Your can rest without sleeping for one day, allowing you to keep watch long into the night.

Low-Light Vision.brief: You can see in low light.
Low-Light Vision.verbose: You can see in low light.

Inherent Magic.brief: You can cast tier zero spells, and start 2 extra from any spellbook.
Inherent Magic.verbose: You are able to cast tier zero spells naturally, and begin with 2 extra tier zero spells from any spellbook.

Wink Wink, Nudge Nudge.brief: You have advantage when dealing with races that find you attractive.
Wink Wink, Nudge Nudge.verbose: Due to your beauty, you have advantage on charisma checks when dealing with races that find you attractive.

Learned.brief: You are fluent in 1 extra language.
Learned.verbose: You are fluent in an extra language of your choosing.

High Elf.quote: High Elves can be slippery folk. It seems to me that rarely say what they mean, and they seldom mean what they say. They're strong mages, though, and too clever for their own good. If you're dealing with elves, try to appeal to their pride, but be careful about it. They can see through simple flattery.
High Elf.author: Ser Gillthunder, Human Knight, Leader of the Hetzer Company (Mercenaries)
High Elf.description: High elves are among the most magical of the races. Reclusive by nature, high elves often confine themselves to gleaming costal cities. When a high elf does venture out into the world at large, it is often in a diplomatic capacity. High elves are as charming as they are naturally beautiful, and commonly feel as though it is their duty to maintain balance in the world. High elves make good mages.

Sleepless.brief: You can rest without sleeping for 1 day.
Sleepless.verbose: Your can rest without sleeping for one day, allowing you to keep watch long into the night.

Dark Vision.brief: You can see in perfect dark.
Dark Vision.verbose: You can see even in perfect darkness.

Winged Feet.verbose: You have advantage on acrobatics checks.

Counter Attack.brief: Reaction. Counterattack when an enemy attacks you.
Counter Attack.verbose: Reaction. You may strike back when an enemy attacks you.

Born in Darkness.brief: You take 1d6 damage per hour when in sunlight unless shaded.
Born in Darkness.verbose: You are incredibly light sensitive, and take 1d6 damage per hour spent with your skin exposed to bright light or to the sun. As a result, you must wear protective garments during the day.

Deep Elf.quote: Elves can be slippery folk. It seems to me that rarely say what they mean, and they seldom mean what they say. They're strong mages, though, and too clever for their own good. If you're dealing with elves, try to appeal to their pride, but be careful about it. They can see through simple flattery.
Deep Elf.author: Ser Gillthunder, Human Knight, Leader of the Hetzer Company (Mercenaries)
Deep Elf.description: Elves are the most magical of the races. Forest-dwellers with long lives, many elves spend their days practicing magic and honing their skills. Elves are naturally beautiful, and this beauty benefits them when they deal with the other races. Elves make strong mages and good dexterity based fighters.

Tinker.brief: 1/night, attempt to invent a recipe. Begin with smoke bomb, firebomb, saddle.
Tinker.verbose: Every night, you can attempt to to create a device. Once you create one, you get its recipe. Must have ingredients. You begin with recipes for smokebombs, firebombs, and saddles. (Tinkering requires an intelligence check)

See and Remember.brief: Once you see something, you probably remember it.
See and Remember.verbose: Once you see something, you will probably remember it.

Gather.verbose: You passively collect ingredients for your tinkering.

Build.brief: If you have a recipe for an item, you can build it. You can attempt to make 1 per rest, 2 per sleep.
Build.verbose: Once you have a recipe for an item, you can build it. You can attempt to build one item per rest, or two per sleep.

Grapple Gun.brief: You have a grapple gun and 40 feet of hooked-rope.
Grapple Gun.verbose: You carry a retractable grappling gun. The gun carries 40 feet of rope.

Resist Magic.brief: Make checks against an enemy's spell power with advantage.
Resist Magic.verbose: You make any rolls against an enemy's spell power with advantage.

Gnome.quote: Gnomes are tiny. They make things, sometimes. I can crush them.
Gnome.author: Throgar, Barbarian and Sheriff
Gnome.description: Tinkerers by nature, Gnomes are known to craft miraculous inventions to help them deal with difficult situations. Gnomes typically stand about three feet in height, and can be recognized by their signature goggles. Gnomes are well rounded and are capable of succeeding at anything they put their minds to.

subsections.text: Moonlight paints the room as the Gnomish Tinker bites her lip. Her project is coming along quite well, better than expected, actually. Not far away, the rest of her party snores as they sleep. She should be sleeping as well, tomorrow is the big day. But then, that's why she needs a spring loaded spear-thrower in the first place. For a moment, she considers lying down, but then pulls her goggles over her eyes. Hopefully, her party was sleeping heavily. With a grin, she lights her acetaline torch, and sparks begin to fly. *Roll an intelligence check!*

subsections.title: Eccentric
subsections.text: Most consider gnomes to be eccentric at best, and obtuse at worse.

Still Warm.brief: You can eat raw meat without penalty.
Still Warm.verbose: You can eat raw meat without penalty.

Dark Vision.brief: You can see in perfect dark.
Dark Vision.verbose: You can see even in perfect darkness.

Seek Gold.brief: You can check for nearby gold.
Seek Gold.verbose: You are able to smell gold. You can perform gold detection checks.

Mantel.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity checks when climbing.

Cheap Blow.brief: On a crit, knock an enemy prone.
Cheap Blow.verbose: On a critical hit, knock an enemy prone.

Goblin.quote: It is a rarity to find a kindly goblin, but when I have, I have found them to be most agreeable companions. Mind you, their penchant for raw flesh can be most off-putting... As can their little yellow eyes. Still, though, if ever you are in a pinch, a loyal goblin-ling can be a fierce, nay, a vicious ally.
Goblin.author: Tamberdoodle, Bard Extraordinare
Goblin.description: Small and wicked, most goblins are tricksters and thieves. Known for eating their kills and living in the dark, goblins prefer to fight with ranged or short weapons. Morally good goblins are rare, and have often been outcast from their clan and family. This can be very painful, as goblins are communal creatures by nature.

Sling.verbose: Your character begins their journey with a 1d4 sling.

Padfoot.verbose: You have advantage on stealth checks.

Carry a Tune.brief: Offhand. Concentration. Sing a song which gives teammates +1 to a stat.
Carry a Tune.verbose: Offhand. You know a song which, when sung, grants all members of your party +1 to a stat of your choice. Concentration.

Lightweight.brief: A drink of alcohol affects you like 2.
Lightweight.verbose: Any cup of alcohol affects you like two.

Nimble.brief: Targeted ranged attacks have disadvantage against you.
Nimble.verbose: Targeted ranged attacks take disadvantage against you.

Fleetfoot Halfling.quote: Halflings are decent enough, and fun to be around. They have potential as rogues since they can see without being seen, but I'm not sure if they're clever enough.
Fleetfoot Halfling.author: Vasha, Catterwol Thief
Fleetfoot Halfling.description: Small folk, the Halflings would rather be drinking tea and eating toast in their holes than adventuring. They are naturally tricksters, are hardy for their size, and are adept at sqeezing into tight spots. On average, the Halflings stand at three-and-a-half feet, and have warm, chestnut colored eyes and hair.

Sling.verbose: Your character begins their journey with a 1d4 sling.

Warm Butter.brief: You can cook food which heals for an extra dice of health during a rest.
Warm Butter.verbose: Your are naturally talented chef. You may cook food which heals allies for an extra dice of health while resting.

Soft Bed.brief: You recover 2d8 additional health when sleeping in a bed.
Soft Bed.verbose: You recover two extra health dice from sleeping in a real bed.

Carry a Tune.brief: Offhand. Concentration. Sing a song which gives teammates +1 to a stat.
Carry a Tune.verbose: Offhand. You know a song which, when sung, grants all members of your party +1 to a stat of your choice. Concentration.

Thick Headed.brief: You have advantage when enemies try to break into your mind.
Thick Headed.verbose: You have advantage on any checks involving an enemy breaking into your mind or dominating you.

Courageous Blow.brief: Add twice your INF to an attack.
Courageous Blow.verbose: Add twice your Inner Fire to an attack.

Hardfoot Halfling.quote: Halflings are decent enough, and fun to be around. They have potential as rogues since they can see without being seen, but I'm not sure if they're clever enough.
Hardfoot Halfling.author: Vasha, Catterwol Thief
Hardfoot Halfling.description: Small folk, the Halflings would rather be drinking tea and eating toast in their holes than adventuring. They are naturally tricksters, are hardy for their size, and are adept at sqeezing into tight spots. On average, the Halflings stand at three-and-a-half feet, and have warm, chestnut colored eyes and hair.

Last Stand.brief: When you are below 25% health, gain an extra action.
Last Stand.verbose: When your health is below 25%, you can take an extra action on your turn.

Strength of Men.verbose: You have basic healing abilities. You may heal a party member for 1d6 + inner fire health.

Rally.brief: Give all allies a 1d8 insp dice.
Rally.verbose: You may use an aura which gives all of your allies a 1d8 inspiration dice.

Adaptable.brief: Gain advantage on subsequent saves for 1 day after a failure.
Adaptable.verbose: Once affected by an effect or spell, gain advantage on saves against it for the remainder of the day.

Skilled.verbose: Begin your journey with one extra skill.

Human.quote: Humans are good, but a little bit tough. That's why you have to eat them raw.
Human.author: Orkensheild, Orc Archer
Human.description: Humans are the most average of the races. The race of men can become good at most things, but it takes a concerted effort for them to become great at anything. That doesn't stop them from trying, though, and it is this natural willpower that makes them a force to be reckoned with.

Color Choice.brief: Change scales' color. Advantage on stealth checks.
Color Choice.verbose: You may choose what color your scales are. Scales may hold only three colors at a time unless Camouflage is being used. This may be used to gain advantage on a stealth check.

Smokevision.brief: You can see when underwater or in smoke.
Smokevision.verbose: Your double eyelids allows you to see well when underwater or in smoke.

Poison Bite.brief: 1d6 bite. If enemy fails SP save, 1d6 damage/turn until save.
Poison Bite.verbose: You may make a bite attack for 1d6 damage. If your enemy fails a D10 inner fire saving throw, they are poisoned and take an additional 1d6 damage at the start of each turn until they pass a D14 inner fire saving throw. At level 5, increase this damage to 1d12. At level 8, increase it to 10, increase it to 2d12.

Poison Resist.brief: You are resistant to poison. Advantage on poison checks, half damage at worst.
Poison Resist.verbose: You are resistant to most poisons. You have advantage on any poison related checks, and take half damage at worst.

Shed Tail.brief: 1/week. Shed your tail to escape a grapple.
Shed Tail.verbose: Once per week, you can shed your tail to escape a grapple.

Taste Air.brief: Gain advantage on PER checks made by tasting the air.
Taste Air.verbose: Gain advantage on tracking perception checks by tasting the air. Works in all environments.

Lizkin.quote: Skin changes like mist. Poisoned teeth lurking within. A Lizkin fighter.
Lizkin.author: Mister Li, Gnomeish Monk

Water Breathing.brief: You only have to breathe once every three days. Must breathe underwater.
Water Breathing.verbose: You only need to breathe once every three days. If you do not go underwater to breath, you will suffocate.

Flows Like Water.brief: You can walk on water and swim as fast as a horse runs.
Flows Like Water.verbose: You can walk on water, and swim as fast as a horse can run.

Water Healing.brief: Sleep in water is like sleep in a bed.
Water Healing.verbose: When you sleep in water, it is as if you are in a bed.

Lightweight.brief: A drink of alcohol affects you like 2.
Lightweight.verbose: Any cup of alcohol affects you like two.

Become Mist.brief: Reaction. Become mist to have an attack pass through you.
Become Mist.verbose: Spend one action point to become mist to have an attack pass right through you as a reaction.

Charm.brief: If enemy fails a SP save, they cannot attack you until success or you attack. Also gain advantage on CHA checks.
Charm.verbose: As an action, you may cast a charm spell on an entity. If the entity fails an inner fire saving throw against your spell power, they cannot attack you until you attack them or they succeed, and you gain advantage on charisma checks with them.

Waterborn.quote: Most Waterborn I've seen have been dried up and dying. Their need for water is their undoing, out here in the desert. Once they've been wetted down a bit, they perk right up. It's then that you have to watch yourself; Waterborn are liable to charm you when you're not looking.
Waterborn.author: Leaf, Gnome Rogue from the Wild Desert
Waterborn.description: Alien among the other races, Waterborn hail from the depths of oceans, lakes, and rivers. Waterborn come in a pleathora of colors, and have ruddy, splotched skin which dries up if it isn't exposed to water regularly. Waterborn are powerful magic users, and are naturally adept at charming the other races.

Predator.verbose: When tracking, you have advantage on perception checks.

Bellow.brief: Force all in earshot to make an SP Save. Frightened on failure.
Bellow.verbose: On your turn, spend one action point to unleash a mighty bellow. All who hear must make an Spell Power save of be frightened.

Thunderous Blow.brief: Roll an extra dice for your attack. On a critical hit, knock the target prone.
Thunderous Blow.verbose: Roll an extra dice for your attack. On a critical hit, knock the enemy prone.

Vengeful Death.brief: When you hit 0 hp, choose to make an attack. If you do, disadv on death coin.
Vengeful Death.verbose: When you are reduced to zero hit points, you may make one last retaliatory action. If you take the retaliatory action, you must make your death coin flips with disadvantage.

Still Warm.brief: You can eat raw meat without penalty.
Still Warm.verbose: You can eat raw meat without penalty.

Orc.quote: The full-orc is a dangerous specimen. Known to hunt and eat the other races, it is difficult to domesticate them. As the saying goes, you can take the orc out of the wilderness, but you can't stop him from trying to eat you.
Orc.author: unattributed folk wisdom
Orc.description: A brutish and warlike race, orcs stab first and ask questions later. Orcs are often used to living in harsh environments, and living off the land.

Stocky.brief: You have advantage against checks made to knock you over.
Stocky.verbose: You have advantage against any check that could cause you to go prone.

Very Dangerous Over Short Distances.brief: If you begin your turn next to an enemy, gain advantage when attacking them. Negates short range disadvantage.
Very Dangerous Over Short Distances.verbose: If you begin your turn next to an enemy, take advantage on your attack roll. Do not take short range disadvantage.

Boozehound.verbose: You have a very high tolerance for alcohol. Do not take disadvantage when drunk.

Thick Headed.brief: You have advantage when enemies try to break into your mind.
Thick Headed.verbose: You have advantage on any checks involving an enemy breaking into your mind or dominating you.

Forgeborn.brief: Gain advantage when appraising or mending stone or steel.
Forgeborn.verbose: When dealing with minerals or works made of stone, gain advantage on any checks made to assess or manipulate them.

Incombustible.brief: You take half damage from heat and fire.
Incombustible.verbose: You take half damage from heat and fire.

Dwarf.quote: Dwarves are difficult to hunt. They're thick, and sturdy; your shot has to be well placed if you want to bring one down.
Dwarf.author: Orkinshield, Orc Gunslinger
Dwarf.description: A stocky, brooding people, many dwarves are natural craftsman and artisans. Dwarves prefer low places, and many of their strongholds can be found deep within mountain ranges. Dwarves have a shrewd eye for business, and have been known to drink their adversaries under the table.

Fix Your Eyes on Me.brief: Force SP save. Fail: you have advantage on CHA and enemy can only attack you.
Fix Your Eyes on Me.verbose: Conversation spell. If the person you are talking with fails an inner fire saving throw against your spell power, the world goes black for them except for you. Make charisma and intimidation checks with advantage for the remainder of the conversation. In combat, force the enemy to attack only you.

Sacrificial Rite.brief: At the cost of half your level in hp (min 1, round down), make an extra action.
Sacrificial Rite.verbose: At the cost of half your level in health (minimum 1, round up), make a second action during combat.

True Sight.verbose: You are able to see invisible entities.

Sleepless.brief: You can rest without sleeping for 1 day.
Sleepless.verbose: Your can rest without sleeping for one day, allowing you to keep watch long into the night.

Incombustible.brief: You take half damage from heat and fire.
Incombustible.verbose: You take half damage from heat and fire.

Daemonspawn.quote: Never trust a daemonspawn, that's what I've alwasy been told. They're as liable to use their dark and terrible magicks as to give you a passing smile. I've never met one though; I've been careful to avoid them.
Daemonspawn.author: Miss Maribel Merkland, Busybody and Baker of Exquisite Pies.
Daemonspawn.description: The daemonspawn were born of an unholy union between elves and the demons of old. When the demons were thrown down and destroyed, the daemonspawn remained. Now, the daemonspawn are left in a world that at best doesn't understand them, and at worst fears and persecutes them. As such, the wise daemonspawn is always vigilant and trusts no one.

Photosynthesis.verbose: Every turn or once per hour, regain 1d4 health.

Small Fry.verbose: Your size is considered tiny. You can fit into small spaces, be easily carried, and be easily thrown.

Soft Landing.verbose: Reduce any falling damage by 20 feet.

Commune with Nature.brief: You can naturally speak to plants and animals.
Commune with Nature.verbose: You are naturally able to speak with plants and animals.

Lightweight.brief: A drink of alcohol affects you like 2.
Lightweight.verbose: Any cup of alcohol affects you like two.

Blade of Grass.brief: You can summon a 1d6 grass blade.
Blade of Grass.verbose: Summon a 1d6 blade of woven plant fiber on command.

Harden.brief: As an offhand action, harden or unharden. Gain +2 armor -2 dexterity. Does not stack.
Harden.verbose: As an offhand action, harden or unharden yourself. While hardened, gain 2 armor but lose 2 dexterity. Does not stack with other armor.

Scurry.brief: Gain advantage on DEX athletics checks.
Scurry.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity based athletics checks.

Dodge.brief: Reaction. When attacked. Roll D17 dex check. Success: attack misses.
Dodge.verbose: Any time you are attacked, roll a d20 and add your dexterity. If you get a 17 or above, the attack misses.

Sprout.quote: And as I walked through the forest, I heard a sound, like the laughter of children. Fearing some trick, I summoned forth my hammer of light. To my shock, the sound came from a race of tree folk, smaller even than the smallest halfling. They were quite dexterous, and spoke the language of my people. I spent some time among their woodland village before continuing on my way.
Sprout.author: Harley, Elf Paladin
Sprout.description: Sprouts are among the smallest of the races, standing at about 2 feet. As a result, they are very weak, but are fast, and good at sneaking. The wise sprout should avoid the front line of combat, and instead stay in relative hiding, jumping out to attack at opportune moments. Sprouts are not necessarily wise, however, and it is not strange to see a sprout knight attempting to make a name for themself.

Power Core.brief: If you die, you can be rebuilt if your power core survives.
Power Core.verbose: The source of your power is housed within you. If you are destroyed in combat, you can be rebuilt so long as the power core survives.

Repair.brief: You cannot heal using potions or rest. Rather, you must repair. Self-repair counts as rest. Repair with help as sleep. Repair with expert as sleep in a bed.
Repair.verbose: You cannot heal using potions or rest. Rather, you must perform repairs. Self repair counts as rest. Repair with help counts as sleep. Repair with a tinker or blacksmith's help counts as sleep in a bed. Blacksmith's must have access to a forge, and tinkers to their tools. Tinker and blacksmith repairs take a minimum of 6 hours.

Upgrades.brief: A tinker can craft upgrades for you.
Upgrades.verbose: A tinker can craft upgrades for you.

Overdrive.brief: Spend 2 health per turn/min to gain +1 STR and DEX. Stackable.
Overdrive.verbose: Spend 2 health per minute or turn to increase strength and dexterity by 1. Can be stacked to a maximum of +5 STR and DEX.

True Sleeplessness.brief: You cannot grow tired or sleep.
True Sleeplessness.verbose: You cannot grow tired, nor can you sleep.

Armored Exterior.brief: Take half damage from piecing, slashing, blunt, fire, and ice attacks.
Armored Exterior.verbose: You naturally take half damage from the following types of attack: piercing, slashing, blunt, fire, and ice. Does not stack with Berserk.

Self Repair.verbose: During combat, you can self repair as an action.

Gyroscopic Center of Mass.brief: Add +5 to any check that involves knocking you prone.
Gyroscopic Center of Mass.verbose: It is difficult to knock you over. Add 5 to any check that involves knocking you prone.

Piston Punch.brief: 1d8 punch. On contested STR fail, knock enemy prone. d12 damage LV4, 2d12 LV8, 3d12 LV12.
Piston Punch.verbose: You may perform a 1d8 strength based punch on an enemy of your choice. If the enemy fails a contested strength check, it is knocked prone. Enemies larger than your size take advantage, smaller take disadvantage. At level 4, increase damage to 1d12. At level 8, to 2d12. At level 12 to 3d12.

Automaton.quote: Well, for a time, I was working on a project to produce artificial life forms, automata, if you will. The project had limited success, and was on the brink of being defunded. In a desperate attempt to keep things going, we turned to magic as a solution. So it was, that he soul gem was discovered. To this day, I wonder what it is exactly that we created. Was it life, or was it some crude approximation? I know not. Nor, I think, does the automaton.
Automaton.author: Simon, Gnome Tinker
Automaton.description: The biproduct of tinkers and mages, the automaton is considered by many to be an artificial being. For this reason, many are persecuted, and treated as mere objects. And perhaps they are. To question your place is to be an automaton, and the quest for meaning is a path that all such beings must walk.

Small Fry.verbose: Your size is considered tiny. You can fit into small spaces, be easily carried, and be easily thrown.

All Tuckered Out.brief: You have to sleep every six hours or be exhausted.
All Tuckered Out.verbose: You must sleep once every six hours, or suffer exhaustion.

Tossed Around.brief: Half blunt damage, tossed 5 feet for every size larger enemy is. Take full damage if you hit something.
Tossed Around.verbose: You take half damage from blunt attacks, but are tossed 5 feet backward for every size larger than you your enemy is. Take full damage if you hit something as a result.

Chomp Chomp.brief: 1d4 bite. Contested dex check to make you let go. Gives enemy disadvantage.
Chomp Chomp.verbose: You can make a 1d4 bite attack as an offhand action. Once you have bitten an enemy, your jaw sets, and you won't let go until even after you are dead. The enemy can attempt contested dexterity checks to try to free themselves of you.

Riding High.brief: You don't give allies disadv when you ride them. Attack advantage while riding.
Riding High.verbose: Allies take no disadvantage while you ride them. You gain advantage on attacks while riding a party member.

Dig Dig Dig.brief: You are good at tunneling. 1 foot per minute.
Dig Dig Dig.verbose: You are able to burrow through earth at a rate of 1 foot per minute.

I'm a Red One!.brief: Choose your color at the start of your journey. Affects elemental resistances.
I'm a Red One!.verbose: At the start of your journey, choose your color. This choice affects elemental resistances.

Hissling.quote: So here's one for you: A while back, we were called to a town by the name of Broshtik to help some yokels. Apparently, things had been going missing. Little things, mostly; utensils and fire pokers and the like. Normally, we wouldn't have taken such a small job, but work had been scarce and beggars can't be choosers. So, anyway, we get to Broshtik, and we spend a good three days poking around, but can't find anything. It gets to the point that we are ready to call it quits and get out of there. Then, one of Harley's rings goes missing overnight. We look around, and find a trail, barely anything, leading through one of the windows. So, out we go, and over to one of the sewer grates in town. We pried it open, and dropped down in. And what do you think we saw? An entire civilization of tiny little lizardlings, that's what. Generations of them, all living in houses built of mud and candlesticks. All at once, the little buggers start taking off like they'd seen Melikar, skittering and running in every direction. Then, an elder approaches us. Or, at least, I think it was an elder; it only came to my knees, and wore a robe made out of a piece of towel. In broken speech, it asked us to leave them be in return for a great gift: two necklaces and a pair of children's shoes. Some times, I wonder if they're still down there.
Hissling.author: Gillthunder, Human Knight
Hissling.description: Next to Sprouts, Hisslings are the smallest of races. Lizardlike entities, Hisslings try their very best to be ferocious. While naturally clever, Hisslings do not cherish knowledge, but rather focus upon helping their clan flourish. The life of a Hissling is often a bleak one: while hisslings can live upwards of 40 years, they rarely do. Instead, most die early due to their fragile nature and disregard for their own safety. Because of the commonality of death in Hissling tribes, most Hisslings put the long-term wellbeing of the collective above that of themselves or even their closest friends and family. Hisslings reach full maturity after only two years, and can reproduce just a few years after.

Peck.brief: Offhand. 1d6 damage. On crit, blind until SP save.
Peck.verbose: As an offhand action, peck an enemy, dealing 1d6 damage. On a critical hit, blind them until they succeed a SP save.

High Jump.brief: Flap your wings to jump upward 2x your height.
High Jump.verbose: Flap your vestigial wings to jump twice your height directly upward.

Coast.brief: Use your wings to avoid fall damage.
Coast.verbose: Use your wings to coast from great heights.

Carrion.brief: Eat raw or rotten food without penalty.
Carrion.verbose: You can eat raw and rotten meat without penalty.

Mimic.verbose: You can mimic any voice you've heard.

Kragraven.quote: I don't trust them, those bird-men that live to the west. Don't trust them one bit.
Kragraven.author: Old Man Mcuffit, Racist Old Man
Kragraven.description: Kragraven stand at about the height of a human, though they are known to hunch over, slightly. Kragraven are reclusive, taking to lofty homes amidst ancient forests. Myths say that Kragraven were first created by the god Ragnhall, and that they are his servants.

Colossal.brief: You are 2 feet taller than average, and are one size larger.
Colossal.verbose: You stand 2 feet taller than the average individual of your race, and are treated as one size larger.

Boozehound.verbose: You have a very high tolerance for alcohol. Do not take disadvantage when drunk.

Ruffians.brief: You have advantage on charisma with common or seedy folk.
Ruffians.verbose: Gain advantage on charisma checks when speaking with seedy individuals, townspeople, or bandits.

Path of Rage Barbarian.description: Barbarians are hearty, and can dole out a lot of damage, making them great tanks for a party of adventurers. They are marked by their berserk ability, which allows them to fly into a battle frenzy, gaining extra attacks and health. Barbarians cannot use magic, and are much better up close than at a distance. They are known for their rugged ways, and usually prefer wide open spaces to cities.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Thrown Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use thrown weapons without disadvantage.
Thrown Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use thrown weapons, such as throwing knives, without disadvantage.

Throw Anything.brief: You can throw anything up to one size larger than yourself.
Throw Anything.verbose: You can throw anything up to one size larger than yourself.

Berserk.brief: +1 STR, DEX. ADV on SP saves. Half physical dmg. 1 hour. Fatigue if ended early.
Berserk.verbose: Go berserk, giving you +1 effective strength and dexterity. Further, gain advantage on Spell Power Saves when berserk and take half damage from any physical attacks. Going berserk lasts for 1 hour. Leaving berserk prematurely makes you fatigued, and gives you disadvantage on all rolls until you next sleep.

Brutal Attack.brief: Add an additional dice of damage. Size based contested STR save. Fail: prone.
Brutal Attack.verbose: Add an additional dice of damage to an attack and force your enemy to make a contested Strength check. The enemy takes advantage if they are larger than you, or disadvantage if they are smaller. On failure, they are knocked prone.

Intimidate.verbose: You have advantage on intimidation checks.

Taunt.brief: SP save. On failure, force all within 30ft. to attack only you. Repeat each turn.
Taunt.verbose: You can taunt your opponents. Foes within 30 feet of you must make an inner fire saving throw or be forced to attack you instead of others. Repeat save each turn.

Throw Caution to the Wind.brief: +1 damage dice to all attacks for a turn, but enemy attacks get advantage.
Throw Caution to the Wind.verbose: On your turn, optionally add an extra damage dice to all of your attacks, but all enemy attacks get advantage on you for a turn.

Single Out.brief: Pick an enemy. Gain 15ft. movement when going towards them and adv on attacks.
Single Out.verbose: Single out an enemy as an offhand action. Gain 15ft. of extra movement on any turn when you move towards them, and gain advantage on all attacks made against them.

Hurl Weapon.brief: Hurl your weapon 5ft x STR or DEX. Attack does 2x damage.
Hurl Weapon.verbose: Throw your weapon up to 5ft. times your Strength or Dexterity. Treat this as a normal attack and then double its damage.

Warrior Spirit.brief: Gain 1 AP when you kill an enemy.
Warrior Spirit.verbose: If you slay an enemy, regain one action point.

Chain Attack.brief: After killing an enemy, gain 10ft movement and free attack or hurl weapon.
Chain Attack.verbose: After slaying an enemy, gain an extra 10 feet of movement and a free attack action or Hurl Weapon.

The Opener.brief: Attack an enemy that hasn't gone, 2x damage, contested STR save. Failure: prone.
The Opener.verbose: If you attack an enemy that has not yet moved in combat, do double damage. If they fail a contested strength saving throw, they are knocked prone.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Adrenaline.brief: Gain 10ft of movement when below 50% health.
Adrenaline.verbose: When you are below 50% health, gain an extra 10 feet of movement.

Terrify.brief: Singled out or Marked enemies must make an SP save. Fail: frightened.
Terrify.verbose: Singled out or Marked enemies must make a spell power save or be frightened.

The Closer.brief: Add two dice of damage to prone enemies.
The Closer.verbose: If you attack an enemy that is prone, add two additional dice of damage.

Savage Critical.brief: On a crit, do an additional dice of damage and give all enemies within 30ft disadv on their next action.
Savage Critical.verbose: On a critical hit, do an additional dice of damage and give all enemies within 30 feet disadvantage on their next action.

Furious Blows.brief: Make two attacks in a single action while going berserk.
Furious Blows.verbose: Attack twice in a single attack action while going berserk.

Arching Swing.brief: Make an attack which hits all adjacent enemies.
Arching Swing.verbose: Make an attack which damages all enemies adjacent to you.

Glory.brief: Extra damage dice when health falls below 25%.
Glory.verbose: When your health falls below 25%, add an extra damage dice to all attacks.

Fury.brief: Add an extra damage dice on turns in which you have been attacked.
Fury.verbose: On a turn in which you have taken damage, add an extra damage dice to all of your attacks.

Spirit of Rage.brief: After slaying an enemy gain an additional full turn.
Spirit of Rage.verbose: After slaying an enemy, gain an additional full turn.

Thrown Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use thrown weapons without disadvantage.
Thrown Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use thrown weapons, such as throwing knives, without disadvantage.

Spiritual Infusion.brief: Offhand. Equip one of your aspects.
Spiritual Infusion.verbose: As an offhand action, equip one of your aspects.

Elk Aspect.brief: Gain 15ft. of extra movement and adv on athletics checks.
Elk Aspect.verbose: Gain an additional 15 feet of movement and advantage on athletics checks.

Wolf Aspect.brief: Advantage on attacks made with an ally and tracking checks.
Wolf Aspect.verbose: If you attack an enemy with an ally, gain advantage. Gain advantage on tracking checks.

Wildcat Aspect.brief: When attacked, role a D17 DEX check. Success: dodge. Advantage on stealth.
Wildcat Aspect.verbose: When attacked, role 1d20 and add your dexterity. On a 17 or above, dodge the attack. Gain advantage on stealth checks.

Bull Aspect.brief: When you attack, size based contested STR save or enemy prone. ADV on STR checks.
Bull Aspect.verbose: Whenever you make an attack, make a size based contested Strength check against your enemy. On failure, they fall prone. Gain advantage on Strength checks.

Bear Aspect.brief: You take half blunt and piercing damage.
Bear Aspect.verbose: You take half blunt and piercing damage.

Elemental Aspect.brief: Convert you damage to a different type. Declare when equipped.
Elemental Aspect.verbose: Convert your damage to a different type. You must declare the type when this aspect is equipped.

Leech Aspect.brief: When you attack, recover 1/2 your level (round up, min 1) in health.
Leech Aspect.verbose: Recover half your level (round up, minimum 1) in health whenever you land a blow.

Dolphin Aspect.brief: Swim at 2x running speed and hold your breath for 15 mins.
Dolphin Aspect.verbose: You can swim at twice your running speed and hold your breath for 15 minutes.

Spiritually Reinforced Blow.brief: Add an extra dice to an attack. STR based contested STR check. Fail: knocked back 10 feet.
Spiritually Reinforced Blow.verbose: Reinforce your attack with the spirits of nature. Add an extra damage dice and force an enemy to make a size based contested strength check. On failure, they are knocked back 10 feet.

Spiritual Aid.brief: Offhand. Grant ally adv on next action or extra dmg dice on next attack.
Spiritual Aid.verbose: As an offhand action, grant an ally spiritual aid which gives them advantage on their next action or an extra damage dice on their next attack.

Spiritual Shield.brief: Reaction. Stop up to 20 damage of enemy attack from hitting you.
Spiritual Shield.verbose: As a reaction, stop up to 20 damage from an enemy attack from hitting you using spiritual energy.

Spiritual Strike.brief: Make a melee attack against an enemy up to 30ft. away.
Spiritual Strike.verbose: A spiritual version of your weapon appears next to an enemy of your choice up to 30 feet away, allowing you to attack them.

Draining Strike.brief: Regain half of the damage you deal as health.
Draining Strike.verbose: Sap an enemies spirit with an attack. Regain half of the damage as health.

Greater Spiritual Infusion.brief: Offhand. Equip two of your aspects.
Greater Spiritual Infusion.verbose: As an offhand action, equip two of your aspects.

Phase Walk.brief: If you kill an enemy with Spiritual Strike, you may teleport to their position.
Phase Walk.verbose: If you kill an enemy with a spiritual weapon, you may instantly teleport to their position.

Warrior Spirit.brief: Gain 1 AP when you kill an enemy.
Warrior Spirit.verbose: If you slay an enemy, regain one action point.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Spiritual Blast.brief: Make an attack which hits all enemies in a 30ft. line in front of you.
Spiritual Blast.verbose: Make an attack with your weapon which harms all enemies in a 30 foot line in front of you.

Chain Strike.brief: Attack an adjacent enemy. The attack chains (1st free). 1d20. 10 or greater, chain.
Chain Strike.verbose: Attack an adjacent enemy with a spiritual weapon. The attack immediately chains to a second enemy within 15 feet. Role 1d20. On 10 or greater, continue the chain and repeat.

Greater Spiritual Shield.brief: Stop up to 50 damage from an enemy attack from hitting all allies within 15ft. of you.
Greater Spiritual Shield.verbose: Block up to 50 damage of an enemy attack from harming any allies within 15 feet of you using spiritual energy.

Major Spiritual Infusion.brief: Offhand. Equip three of your aspects.
Major Spiritual Infusion.verbose: As an offhand action, equip three of your aspects.

Infuse Other.brief: Infuse an ally for one hour or 1 battle.
Infuse Other.verbose: Grant an ally the benefit of your of your aspects for 1 battle or 1 hour.

Greater Phase Walk.brief: Phase walk any time you use a spiritual weapon.
Greater Phase Walk.verbose: You may now spend 1 action point to phase walk to an enemy any time you strike them with a spiritual weapon.

Rouse to Action.brief: Offhand. Grant an ally full movement and an action.
Rouse to Action.verbose: As an offhand action, grant an ally their full movement an an action.

Form Shift.brief: Transform into the spirit of one of your equipped aspects.
Form Shift.verbose: The power of one of your aspects fills you. Transform into the shape of the aspect. Stats in the book of known beasts.

Legendary Spiritual Infusion.brief: Offhand. Equip six of your aspects.
Legendary Spiritual Infusion.verbose: As an offhand action, equip six of your aspects.

Path of Nature Barbarian.standings: Barbarians are the enemies of law keepers.

Armored.brief: You have a suit of chainmail.
Armored.verbose: You begin your journey with a suit of chainmail.

Knight.description: Knights are heavy, armored fighters who should place themselves between their party and harm's way. The ideal knight is a bastion of good, a defender of the innocent and the embodiment of chivalry. Knights hold sway over kingsmen, and are able to protect their allies.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Shield Training.brief: Don't take movement penalties from shield use.
Shield Training.verbose: Don't take movement penalties from shield use.

Armor Training.brief: Don't take movement penalties from armor use.
Armor Training.verbose: Don't take movement penalties from armor use.

Kingsmen.brief: You have advantage on charisma with kingsmen.
Kingsmen.verbose: Gain advantage on charisma checks when speaking with kingsmen.

Overwhelming Strike.brief: Additional damage dice. Size based contested STR check. Fail: Next attack has advantage.
Overwhelming Strike.verbose: Batter away an enemies defenses. Add a damage dice to your attack and force the enemy to make a size based contested Strength check. On failure, the next attack against the enemy has advantage.

Pivot.brief: Offhand: swap spaces with adjacent ally.
Pivot.verbose: As an offhand action, trade spaces with an adjacent ally.

Steel Yourself.brief: Choose to take half damage from an attack.
Steel Yourself.verbose: Choose to take half damage from an attack.

Shield Bash.brief: Offhand. Contested STR check. Fail: lose action. d4 damage LV0 d8 LV4, d10 LV8, d12 LV12.
Shield Bash.verbose: Use an offhand action to shield bash an enemy, dealing 1d4 damage and staggering them if they fail a contested strength check. A staggered enemy loses one of its actions. At level 4, damage increases to 1d8. At level 8, damage increases to 1d10. At level 12, damage increases to 1d12.

Ready Stance.brief: Offhand: one time you are attacked before next turn, counterattack.
Ready Stance.verbose: As an offhand action, ready your stance. One time you are attacked before your next turn, counterattack.

Shield of Men.brief: Reaction. Take a teammates damage for them. Damage is halved. 30ft rad.
Shield of Men.verbose: Reaction. Once per round of combat, you can throw yourself in front of a teammate, taking their damage for them. Any damage you receive as a result is halved. Works up to 15 feet.

Last Line of Defense.brief: If your allies are on death's door or have died, add a dmg dice to all attacks.
Last Line of Defense.verbose: If any of your allies are on death's door or have died during this encounter, add an extra damage dice to all of your attacks.

None Shall Pass.brief: When you hit a passing entity, size based contested STR check. Fail: stopped.
None Shall Pass.verbose: If you hit an enemy with your exposed attack, they must make a size based contested strength check or be stopped in their tracks.

Press the Advantage.brief: Shield bash for free when you crit.
Press the Advantage.verbose: When you land a critical hit, gain a free shield bash attack.

Advance.brief: If you slay an enemy, you may move forward into their space.
Advance.verbose: If you slay an enemy with a melee attack, you may step forward into the space that they occupied.

Knight's Challenge.brief: Offhand: SP save. Fail: Forced to attack you. Regardless, you have attack advantage.
Knight's Challenge.verbose: As an offhand action, issue a challenge to one of your enemies. The enemy must make an spell power save or be forced to attack only you. Regardless, you have advantage when attacking a challenged enemy.

Charge.brief: Offhand. Charge an extra 10ft. Size based contested STR check if you hit someone. Loser is knocked prone.
Charge.verbose: As an offhand action, charge forward an additional 10 feet. If you run into someone, make a contested Strength Check. The loser is knocked prone.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Inspiring Critical.brief: When you land a crit or kill an enemy, give a chosen ally 1d10 inspiration.
Inspiring Critical.verbose: Inspire an ally when you land a critical hit or slay an enemy. Grant a chosen ally a d10 inspiration dice.

Cleave.brief: Hit up to 2 side by side enemies with melee attacks.
Cleave.verbose: Strike up to two adjacent foes when you make a melee attack.

Greater Charge.brief: Charge now goes 15ft. and ends in an attack.
Greater Charge.verbose: Your charge now carries you 15 feet, and may end in an attack.

Stay on Your Feet.brief: If your health hits 0, make a D10 INF save. On success, drop to 1 hp instead.
Stay on Your Feet.verbose: If you fall to zero health, make a D10 inner fire saving throw. If you succeed, drop to 1 health instead.

Controlled Advance.brief: When you use Advance, gain either an attack or a Ready Stance.
Controlled Advance.verbose: When you use the Advance ability, gain an action which may be used to either attack again or to ready your stance.

Defender Aura.brief: Grant allies within 30ft half damage from physical attacks for 3 turns.
Defender Aura.verbose: Grant all allies within 30 feet of you half damage from physical attacks for three turns.

Resilient Defense.brief: A single attack can do at most 50 dmg to you.
Resilient Defense.verbose: You have become so hardened by combat that a single attack can deal at most 50 damage to you.

Warrior's Vow.verbose: You gain an extra attack against an entity you have challenged.

questions: How did your character get where they are, and where they are going next?
Are they already annointed as a knight, or are they still aspiring to knighthood?
Do they follow the code of chivalry, or consider it to be a guideline?
How will being a knight affect the way that you interact with your party?
Knight.standings: Knights are loved by kingsmen, and distrusted by hedge knights and rangers. Knights are duty bound to fight the lawless.

Minor Spell Choice.brief: You know an extra tier 0 spell.
Minor Spell Choice.verbose: At the start of your journey, you know 1 extra tier zero spells.

Armored.brief: You have a suit of chainmail.
Armored.verbose: You begin your journey with a suit of chainmail.

Paladin.description: Palidins are Soldiers of the Light, and are adept both at hand to hand combat and basic healing magic. Paladins are devoted to their deity, and aim to bring their influence into the world. Paladins are especially good at taking out evil entities, and are known for their Faithful Weapon ability, which lets them summon their weapon to their hand after throwing it.

The Book of Healing.brief: You have access to the Book of Healing.
The Book of Healing.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Book of Healing.

Learning Spells.brief: You can learn new spells from spellbooks or when you level up.
Learning Spells.verbose: New spells or techniques are obtained by leveling up or by finding spellbooks or scrolls in the world. A spellbook may contain a specific spell, or a maximum spell tier. Spellbooks with a maximum spell tier contain one spell of your choice from the spellbooks that you can learn from with a tier up to the spellbook's maximum spell tier.

Learn Spells.brief: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier you have access to.
Learn Spells.verbose: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier that you have access to. Spells must be learned from one of your spellbooks.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Thrown Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use thrown weapons without disadvantage.
Thrown Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use thrown weapons, such as throwing knives, without disadvantage.

Minor Boon.brief: You have a minor boon from your deity:
Minor Boon.verbose: You have access to a minor boon from your chosen deity. See the pantheon for details.

Shield Training.brief: Don't take movement penalties from shield use.
Shield Training.verbose: Don't take movement penalties from shield use.

Armor Training.brief: Don't take movement penalties from armor use.
Armor Training.verbose: Don't take movement penalties from armor use.

Tier Zero Spells.verbose: You have achieved a basic knowledge of the arcane, and may now learn tier zero spells from any of your spellbooks.

Pledge.verbose: At the start of your journey, you may select a deity to pledge yourself to.

Hammer of Light.brief: You do an additional dice of damage to undead.
Hammer of Light.verbose: Any weapon that you wield does an additional dice of damage to undead.

Faithful Weapon.brief: Your weapon returns when you throw it.
Faithful Weapon.verbose: After throwing your weapon, you can return it to yourself. You do not take disadvantage when throwing hammers or maces.

Pivot.brief: Offhand: swap spaces with adjacent ally.
Pivot.verbose: As an offhand action, trade spaces with an adjacent ally.

Healing Blow.brief: Additional damage dice. 1/4 damage done by attack is restored to you and allies within 15 feet.
Healing Blow.verbose: Add a dice of damage to your attack or spell. One quarter of the damage done by the attack is restored to yourself and any allies within 15 feet of you.

Tier One Spells.verbose: Your powers are growing. You may now learn tier one spells from any of your spellbooks.

Bash.brief: Stun an enemy on a critical hit.
Bash.verbose: Stun an enemy on a critical hit, causing them to miss an action and an offhand action on their next turn.

Guardian Ward.brief: Offhand. Grant an ally a ward which gives them +1 armor. One ally at a time.
Guardian Ward.verbose: As an offhand action, Say a fervent prayer to place a ward on an ally. The marked ally gains +1 armor. At most one ally may have a guardian ward at a time.

Healing Blast.brief: 30ft. Cone. Heals allies, harms enemies. 1/2 your level (round up) d4.
Healing Blast.verbose: Fire a 30 foot cone of healing energy. All allies struck by it regain half your level (round up) d4's in health. Deals damage to enemies.

Holy Shield.brief: Give an ally or yourself a shield with health equal to 2x your level.
Holy Shield.verbose: Grant an ally or yourself a holy shield with health equal to twice your level.

Link Lifeforce.brief: Offhand. Link to warded ally/allies. Take share healing/damage. Free unlink on your turn. All damage must be taken by someone.
Link Lifeforce.verbose: As an offhand action, link your life force to an ally with a guardian ward. Until you unlink yourself as a free action on your turn, you may take all or a portion of the damage dealt to them. All damage done must be taken by one of the recipients, and neither may go below zero health unless both do.

Minor Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 0 spell as an offhand.
Minor Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier zero spell as an offhand action.

Tier Two Spells.verbose: You have graduated from novice to proficient! You may now learn tier two spells from any of your spellbooks.

Enhanced Healing.brief: 2 extra dice of healing to allies with a guardian ward.
Enhanced Healing.verbose: Add two extra dice of healing when healing an ally with a guardian ward.

Greater Boon.brief: You have a greater boon from your deity:
Greater Boon.verbose: You have access to a greater boon from your chosen deity. See the pantheon for details.

Greater Guardian Ward.verbose: Your guardian wards now grant +2 armor

Warrior Spirit.brief: Gain 1 AP when you kill an enemy.
Warrior Spirit.verbose: If you slay an enemy, regain one action point.

Tier Three Spells.verbose: Magical energy flows through you. You may now learn tier three spells from any of your spellbooks.

Greater Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 1 spell as an offhand.
Greater Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier one spell as an offhand action.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Last Hope.brief: Double healing while an ally is down or has died in this combat.
Last Hope.verbose: Double any healing that you do while an ally has fallen in this combat or is currently at death's door.

Blessing of Protection.brief: On a critical hit, give a holy shield on an ally or yourself.
Blessing of Protection.verbose: After landing a critical hit, you may immediately place a holy shield on an ally or yourself.

Beacon of Hope.brief: Passive. All allies within 100 feet gain +2 to all saving throws.
Beacon of Hope.verbose: Passive. All allies within 100 feet of you gain +2 to all saving throws.

Major Boon.brief: You have a major boon from your deity:
Major Boon.verbose: You have access to a major boon from your chosen deity. See the pantheon for details.

Tier Four Spells.verbose: You are a master of your spellcraft. You can now learn tier four spells from any of your spellbooks.

Major Guardian Ward.verbose: Your guardian wards now grant +3 armor

Second Guardian Ward.brief: You may now place a guardian ward on 2 allies.
Second Guardian Ward.verbose: You may now place guardian wards on two allies.

Greater Link Lifeforce.brief: Halve any damage taken via link lifeforce.
Greater Link Lifeforce.verbose: Halve any damage taken from linking lifeforce with an ally with a guardian ward.

Guardian Spirit.brief: Regain 1AP when an ally with a guardian ward slays an enemy.
Guardian Spirit.verbose: When an ally with a guardian ward strikes down an enemy, regain 1 action point.

Tier Five Spells.verbose: You have achieved the highest form of sorcery, and are a mage to be reckoned with. You can now learn tier five spells from any of your spellbooks.

Ward Conversion.brief: Reaction or Offhand. Convert guardian wards to holy shields.
Ward Conversion.verbose: As a reaction or Offhand Action, convert any guardian wards to holy shields.

Mass Holy Shield.brief: Grant all allies within 30 feet a holy shield.
Mass Holy Shield.verbose: Grant all allies within 30 feet a holy shield.

Legendary Boon.brief: You have a legendary boon from your deity:
Legendary Boon.verbose: You have access to a legendary boon from your chosen deity. See the pantheon for details.

Greater Holy Shield.brief: Holy shields now grant 1 turn of invulnerability before gaining normal health.
Greater Holy Shield.verbose: Holy shields grant one turn of invulnerability before they gain their normal health.

What their relationship is like with their deity? Do they pray to them often?
