Paladin.standings: Paladins are generally respected. They hate evil, and try to destroy it wherever they find it.

Beastmaster.description: For the Beastmaster 'Animal Person' is an understatement. Beastmaster's begin their adventure with a loyal animal companion, which they can select from the Book of Known Beasts. This can include a wolf, a bear, and eagle, or even a dragon! Most Beastmasters have forgone civilization, choosing instead to roam the wilds, capturing and befriending animals. They are quick, dexterity based fighters, and are good at tackling and hobbling enemies and leading their party through the wilds.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Animal Magnetism.brief: You may attempt CHA checks to manipulate animals.
Animal Magnetism.verbose: Most animals inherently understand you on some level. You can attempt to persuade the actions of animals.

Animal Companion.brief: Choose a companion pup, kid, cub, or hatchling from the book of known beasts.
Animal Companion.verbose: You may choose a companion animal. Choose a level 0 light creature denoted as a pup, kid, or cub, from the beasts section or a dragon hatchling from the book of known beasts.

Tracker.verbose: You are an excellent tracker, and have advantage when looking for trails and sign of passage.

Leaping Strike.brief: Leap 5 feet forward to an additional dice of damage.
Leaping Strike.verbose: Leap 5 feet forward to attack an enemy, dealing an additional dice of damage. This distance can be added to your movement, but must be used to land an attack.

Tackle.brief: Advantage when grappling. Choose STR or DEX contested save.
Tackle.verbose: You can tackle an enemy up to one size larger than you to the ground. Attempt either a dexterity or strength contested throw against the enemy, on which you have advantage. If they fail, you grapple them.

Hobble.brief: Tie up grappled enemies. Each turn, they make a STR SP save to escape.
Hobble.verbose: You are capable of quickly tying very strong knots without a check. If you have an entity grappled, you may hobble them with an action. Hobbled entities may attempt a strength saving throw against your spell power each turn to attempt to escape. Hobbled entities make all movements with disadvantage, and cannot attack with a handheld weapon.

Huntsman.brief: You have advantage when attacking beasts.
Huntsman.verbose: You have advantage when attacking beasts.

Coordinated Attack.brief: If you and your animal attack the same entity, both get advantage.
Coordinated Attack.verbose: If you and your animal companion are both attacking the same entity, you both gain advantage on your attacks.

Dog Pile.brief: Any sleep taken with your animal counts as sleep in a bed.
Dog Pile.verbose: Any sleep taken while with your animal companion counts as sleep in a bed.

Closest Friend.brief: Gain advantage in all things if your animal is on deaths door and vice versa.
Closest Friend.verbose: Gain advantage in all things if your animal companion is on deaths door or has died in the current battle. Similarly, if you are at death's door or have died, your animal companion takes advantage in all things.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Wild Sight.brief: You can see through your animal's eyes.
Wild Sight.verbose: Cast a minor spell to see through the eyes of your animal companion.

Inseparable.brief: Offhand. Teleport yourself to your animal or vice versa.
Inseparable.verbose: Cost a minor spell to instantly teleport from your current position to a spot within five feet of your animal companion. The same can be done by your animal companion. Counts as an offhand action.

Dominate.brief: If enemy fails SP save, they must obey until they save, you attack, or you give them a distressing order.
Dominate.verbose: You may attempt to dominate an enemy. If they fail an inner fire saving throw, they must obey you. They can attempt a saving throw every turn thereafter or if you give them an order that causes them significant distress.

Beast Form.brief: Transform back and forth into a dire creature for one hour.
Beast Form.verbose: Transform yourself into a dire creature of your choosing. For one hour, you may transform back and forth as an action. While in your beast form, you have the physical stats of the chosen creature. If your health falls to zero, you are instantly transformed back into your normal form, with the health that you had prior to using beast shape.

questions: Does your character live in the wilds, and if so, why?
How often do they speak with other people?
How did they meet their animal companion?
Why did their animal companion stay with them?
How will being a beastmaster affect how you interact with your party?
Beastmaster.standings: More comfortable in nature than cities, Beastmasters get on best with animals, and can find people difficult to talk to.

Fighter.description: Fighters are powerful strength or dexterity based warriors. Unlike the knight, fighters are unarmored, and have a skillset more suited to keeping themselves alive and bringing down enemies than providing support.

Focused Attack.brief: Re-roll an attack after you make it.
Focused Attack.verbose: Re-roll an attack after you make it.

Ranged Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use bows and throwing weapons without disadvantage.
Ranged Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use bows, throwing weapons, and simple projectile weapons without disadvantage.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Determination.brief: Offhand. Gain a 1d10 INSP as an offhand action.
Determination.verbose: Gain a d10 inspiration dice as an offhand action.

Minor Second Wind.brief: Heal yourself for 1d6 damage as an offhand.
Minor Second Wind.verbose: Heal yourself for 1d6 damage as an offhand action.

Resolve.brief: When your health drops below 25%, all attacks do half damage against you.
Resolve.verbose: When your health drops below 25%, all attacks do half damage against you.

Nimble.brief: Targeted ranged attacks have disadvantage against you.
Nimble.verbose: Targeted ranged attacks take disadvantage against you.

Reduced Critical.verbose: Decrease your critical hit target by 1.

Greater Second Wind.brief: Heal yourself for 1d12 damage as an offhand.
Greater Second Wind.verbose: Heal yourself for 1d12 damage as an offhand action.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Major Second Wind.brief: Heal yourself for 2d10 damage as an offhand.
Major Second Wind.verbose: Heal yourself for 2d10 damage as an offhand action.

Find Center.brief: Free Action. Gain advantage on all things for 1 turn.
Find Center.verbose: Free Action. Take advantage in all things for one turn.

Stay on Your Feet.brief: If your health hits 0, make a D10 INF save. On success, drop to 1 hp instead.
Stay on Your Feet.verbose: If you fall to zero health, make a D10 inner fire saving throw. If you succeed, drop to 1 health instead.

Reduced Critical.verbose: Decrease your critical hit target by 1.

Whirlwind of Blades.brief: Make an additional 3 attacks on your turn.
Whirlwind of Blades.verbose: Make an additional 3 attacks on your turn.

questions: Does your character specialize in strength or dexterity based weapons?
How did they learn to fight, and why are they good at it?
Do they like fighting?
What are their goals?
How will being a fighter affect the way that you interact with your party?
Fighter.standings: Fighters come from all walks of life.

My Father's Coffers.verbose: Begin your journey with significant additional funds.

The Family Sword.verbose: Begin your journey with a 1d6 sword with a ruby on its hilt and an engraving of your family's sigil.

Lightweight.brief: A drink of alcohol affects you like 2.
Lightweight.verbose: Any cup of alcohol affects you like two.

Beauty Incarnate.brief: Gain advantage and +2 CHA when speaking with people that find you attractive.
Beauty Incarnate.verbose: Gain advantage and +2 charisma when speaking to individuals who find your sex attractive.

Highborn.description: Highborns were born into a noble house and have connections and money as a result. They are well trained fighters, and have the charisma necessary to rally people to their side. While the typical highborn is not as hardened as a knight or fighter, they are able to call upon their gumption for spurts of incredible heroism.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Happy Smiles.brief: 1/day in good weather, give party a 1d8 INSP dice. In bad weather, -1 CHA.
Happy Smiles.verbose: Your presence increases party cheer in good weather, giving them a d8 inspiration dice once per day. It also decreases it in bad weather, giving them -1 charisma.

My People.brief: Gain advantage on CHA with guards and +2 CHA when in your domain.
My People.verbose: Gain advantage when speaking with guards and +2 charisma when speaking with citizens in your family's territory.

Swoon.brief: Reaction. Faint to avoid further damage for 1 turn.
Swoon.verbose: During battle, you can faint as a reaction or offhand action to avoid further damage. You may wake up after one turn.

Mantel.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity checks when climbing.

Gumption.brief: Spend an action point to add 1d10 to a check.
Gumption.verbose: You may spend an action point to add 1d10 to a check.

Disarming.brief: Reaction. Force enemy to make INF save VS CHA. Fail: attack disadv.
Disarming.verbose: Reaction. Force an enemy that attacks you to make an inner fire saving throw against 12 + your charisma. If they fail, their attack must be made with disadvantage.

Fallen.brief: While you are on death's door, all of your allies get a bonus action.
Fallen.verbose: While you are on death's door, all of your allies gain a bonus action.

Feeling Lucky.brief: Add a number of d4's equal to your luck to an attack.
Feeling Lucky.verbose: Add a number of d4's equal to your luck to an attack.

Spurred to Movement.brief: You can use an action point to perform an action.
Spurred to Movement.verbose: You may can spend an action point to perform an action on your turn.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Rally Cry.brief: Offhand. Allow all allies to do an additional dice of damage on their next attack.
Rally Cry.verbose: Let out a rally cry as an offhand action which allows all allies to do an additional dice of damage on their next attack.

Aura of Peace.brief: Passive. All allies gain 10 health when in your presence.
Aura of Peace.verbose: Passive. All allies near you take heart, and gain 10 health while in your presence.

questions: Why is your character embarking on their adventure? Are they out to prove themself? Or perhaps they are idealistic and want adventure?
Are they brave?
Do they know what they are getting themselves into?
Where are your character's parents, and what is their relationship with them?
How will being a highborn affect how you interact with others and your party?
Highborn.standings: Of noble birth, your character is loved by their people, but is prone to attacks by thieves and brigands.

Starting Fighting Techniques.verbose: Begin your journey with two standard fighting techniques.

Monk.description: Monks are masters of hand to hand combat, who use their extensive control of their bodies to overcome their foes. Monks are able to learn abilities from scrolls, which they may find scattered throughout the world. Monks have dedicated themself to the art of understanding the natural and spiritual world, and are often levelheaded and intelligent. As you create your monk, consider what their goals are. How did they become a monk, and what are they hoping to gain by doing so? How do they react in stressful situations? How do they interact with other people? Are they quiet and reserved? Confident and sure of themself? How will being a monk affect the way you interact with your party?

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Fighting Techniques.brief: You can learn basic fighting techniques.
Fighting Techniques.verbose: You may learn a new fighting technique from the book of chi.

The Book of Chi.brief: You have access to the Book of Chi.
The Book of Chi.verbose: You may select 2 combat techniques and 2 general techniques from the Book of Chi at the start of your journey.

Learn Fighting Techniques.brief: Each time you level up, learn 1 fighting technique from each tier you have access to.
Learn Fighting Techniques.verbose: Each time you level up, learn one fighting technique from each fighting technique tier you have access to.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Master Fighting Techniques.brief: You can learn master fighting techniques.
Master Fighting Techniques.verbose: You may learn a new master fighting technique from the book of chi.

Legendary Fighting Techniques.brief: You can learn legendary fighting techniques.
Legendary Fighting Techniques.verbose: You may learn a new legendary fighting technique from the book of chi.

Monk.standings: Monks keep to themselves, which cause some outside of their religion to attempt to take advantage of them.

Under the Stars.brief: All sleep counts as sleep in a bed.
Under the Stars.verbose: You have been forced to learn to sleep anywhere. All sleep acts as though you are in a bed.

Ranger.description: Rangers are the vigilante law keepers and monster hunters of the wilds. Rangers are powerful dexterity based fighters, and are known for their abiltiy to dual weild weapons. Rangers are masters of the wilds, and are able to easily traverse the wilds, as well as to prepare simple medicines in times of need. Rangers are often known by common folk to be quiet and mysterious, however, they are well loved, as it is understood that they are the thin line that stands between many villages and an onslaught of monsters. As you create your ranger, consider how they ended up a ranger? How did they become so adept at navigating the wilderness? Do they feel the need to protect villagers? What kinds of monsters have they fought? Who trained them, if anyone? How will being a ranger affect the way that you interact with your party?

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Ranged Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use bows and throwing weapons without disadvantage.
Ranged Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use bows, throwing weapons, and simple projectile weapons without disadvantage.

Minor Medicine.brief: Spend 20 mins to create a salve. Lasts 24 hours.
Minor Medicine.verbose: Spend 20 minutes to create a salve. Salves keep for 24 hours.

Tracker.verbose: You are an excellent tracker, and have advantage when looking for trails and sign of passage.

Camouflage.verbose: If you stay absolutely still, you can take on the color of your surroundings. This gives you advantage on stealth checks while camouflaged.

Embers.brief: Shoot fire 10ft. Deals 1d4 dmg. Increases to 1d8 at LV3, 1d10 LV6, 1d12 LV9, 2d12 LV12.
Embers.verbose: Cast forth fire from your hand with a range of 10 feet. Deals 1d4 damage. This increases to 1d8 at level 3, 1d10 at level 6, 1d12 at level 9, and 2d12 at level 12.

Entangling Attack.brief: Force enemy SP save on attack. On fail, ensnared. Repeat check each turn.
Entangling Attack.verbose: You may attempt to entangle an enemy during one of your attacks using minor magic. The enemy must make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On a failure, the entity is ensnared, and cannot move. It may re-attempt the saving throw to escape every turn thereafter. An ensnared enemy may not move, and all attacks made against it have advantage.

Finesse Strike.brief: Add an additional dice to an attack. Enemy SP save. On fail same next turn.
Finesse Strike.verbose: Add an additional dice of damage to an attack of your choosing. If the affected entity fails an inner fire saving throw against your spell power, it suffers as much bleeding damage at the start of its next turn.

Spell of Darkvision.verbose: As an Offhand Action, you may use minor magic to give yourself darkvision for one hour.

Twin Blades.brief: You can attack twice in a single action.
Twin Blades.verbose: You are able to wield two weapons. You may attack with both in a single action.

Twin Blade Parry.verbose: Once per round of combat, you may strike back when an enemy attacks you.

Greater Medicine.brief: Spend 20 mins to create 1 Minor Health Potion. Last 24 hours.
Greater Medicine.verbose: Spend 20 minutes to create a Minor Health Potion. Potions last 24 hours.

Elemental Weapon.brief: Change the primary damage die for your weapon to deal elemental damage. Lasts until dispelled.
Elemental Weapon.verbose: Change the primary damage die for your weapon to deal elemental damage of your choice. Lasts until dispelled.

Expert Tracker.brief: Add 1d6 to checks made when tracking.
Expert Tracker.verbose: Add 1d6 to any checks made to track an individual.

Major Medicine.brief: Spend 20 mins to create 1 Greater Health Potion per day. Last 24 hours.
Major Medicine.verbose: Spend 20 minutes to create a Greater Health Potion. Potions last 24 hours.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Fire and Ice.brief: Imbue 1 weapon with fire and another with ice. +1d6 damage for 1 battle.
Fire and Ice.verbose: Imbue one of your blades with fire and the other with ice. Each do an additional 1d6 damage for the duration of a battle.

Ranger.standings: Barbarians are the enemies of law keepers.

A Thief's Gear.brief: You have 100 feet of rope, a lockpick, a smoke-bomb, a 1d6 dagger.
A Thief's Gear.verbose: You begin with 100 feet of rope, a lock-picking kit, a smoke-bomb, and a hidden 1d6 dagger.

Thief.description: Sneaktheives and criminals, rogues have often fallen in with bad company. Rogues are incredibly nimble and stealthy, and are able to clime, sneak, and lockpick their way into most anything. Rogues are very weak, however, and will have better luck running away than fighting if caught. When they have to fight, Rogues often pick daggers or shortswords, and strike from on high or from in the shadows, letting their more armored friends soak up the damage.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Thrown Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use thrown weapons without disadvantage.
Thrown Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use thrown weapons, such as throwing knives, without disadvantage.

Nimble Fingers.brief: Gain advantage on DEX when stealing.
Nimble Fingers.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity and stealth checks made while stealing.

Mantel.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity checks when climbing.

Disengage.brief: Avoid provoking exposed attacks. Ends if you make an attack.
Disengage.verbose: Spend an action point to avoid provoking exposed attacks. This effect ends if you make an attack.

Disappear.brief: Offhand. Attempt to hide. Must be out of sight and out of mind.
Disappear.verbose: Use an offhand action to attempt to hide. You must be out of line of sight of enemies and not where they would reasonably expect you to be.

Strike From the Shadows.brief: Do an additional dice of damage on attacks made from hiding.
Strike From the Shadows.verbose: Do an additional dice of damage on an attacks made from hiding.

Pickpocket.brief: Extra damage dice. Contested Dex Check. On success, steal something from the enemy.
Pickpocket.verbose: Add a damage dice to an attack and force the target to make a contested dexterity check. On success, steal something from the enemy.

Dodge.brief: Reaction. When attacked. Roll D17 dex check. Success: attack misses.
Dodge.verbose: Any time you are attacked, roll a d20 and add your dexterity. If you get a 17 or above, the attack misses.

Trap Expert.brief: Gain advantage on anything trap related.
Trap Expert.verbose: Gain advantage when looking for, disarming, or creating traps.

Slip Away.brief: When you slay an enemy, disengage for free.
Slip Away.verbose: When you slay an enemy, you may immediately disengage for free.

Master of Disguise.verbose: You can easily fashion disguises to hide yourself with. Gain advantage when crafting disguises.

Flow with the Battle.brief: Move through spaces occupied by enemies at a 10ft. of movement penalty. Still exposed.
Flow with the Battle.verbose: Move through spaces occupied by enemies at a cost of 10 feet of movement. You still leave yourself exposed as you do this.

Flank.brief: You have attack advantage vs. and are considered hiding when behind harried enemies.
Flank.verbose: If an enemy is harried --one of your allies is adjacent -- gain advantage on attacks made from behind it. You are considered to be hiding from an enemy while flanking it.

Ride the Blindspot.brief: If a flanked enemy turns to attack you, pivot to stay behind it.
Ride the Blindspot.verbose: If you are flanking an enemy and it tries to turn to look at you, spend an action point to pivot around it.

Assisted Strike.brief: If you have attack advantage, you can add a damage dice instead. Stacks.
Assisted Strike.verbose: If you have advantage on an attack, you may instead add an additional dice of damage to it. This stacks from multiple sources.

Soft Landing.verbose: Reduce any falling damage by 20 feet.

High Ground.brief: You have advantage on plunging attacks
High Ground.verbose: You have advantage on plunging attacks.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Break Away.brief: If you begin a turn flanking an enemy, move away without being exposed.
Break Away.verbose: If you begin a turn flanking an enemy, you may break from them without provoking exposed attacks.

Sticky Fingers.brief: Add 1d4 to checks made to steal something.
Sticky Fingers.verbose: Add 1d4 to any check made to steal something.

Soundless.verbose: Gain an additional 1d6 on stealth checks.

Party Save.brief: Add 1d10 to all allies' stealth check.
Party Save.verbose: Give all allies 1d10 to role on a stealth check..

Mark.brief: Offhand. Mark an enemy. Marked enemies have disadv in attacks against you and are harried. You have advantage while tracking them.
Mark.verbose: As an offhand action, mark an enemy. While marked, the enemy takes disadvantage in all attacks made against you and is considered to be harried. You gain advantage while tracking marked enemies.

Greater Dodge.brief: Reaction. When attacked. Roll D17 dex check. Success: attack misses.
Greater Dodge.verbose: Any time you are attacked, roll a d20 and add your dexterity. If you get a 17 or above, the attack misses.

Greater Flow with the Battle.brief: No movement penalty for moving through enemy spaces.
Greater Flow with the Battle.verbose: Passing through enemy spaces no longer results in a movement penalty.

Greater Slip Away.brief: Regain full movement when you slip away.
Greater Slip Away.verbose: When you slip away, also regain your full movement.

Redirecting Dodge.brief: Redirect any dodged damage to an enemy within range.
Redirecting Dodge.verbose: Redirect any dodged damage to an enemy within range.

Who do they tend to target, and why?
Do their crimes involve hurting people? Theivery? Information gathering?
How did they get so good at what they do?

A Thief's Gear.verbose: You begin with 100 feet of rope, a lock-picking kit, a smoke-bomb, and a hidden 1d6 dagger.

Thrown Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use thrown weapons without disadvantage.
Thrown Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use thrown weapons, such as throwing knives, without disadvantage.

Mantel.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity checks when climbing.

Master of Disguise.verbose: You can easily fashion disguises to hide yourself with. Gain advantage when crafting disguises.

Predator.verbose: When tracking, you have advantage on perception checks.

Disengage.brief: Avoid provoking exposed attacks. Ends if you make an attack.
Disengage.verbose: Spend an action point to avoid provoking exposed attacks. This effect ends if you make an attack.

Disappear.brief: Offhand. Attempt to hide. Must be out of sight and out of mind.
Disappear.verbose: Use an offhand action to attempt to hide. You must be out of line of sight of enemies and not where they would reasonably expect you to be.

Strike From the Shadows.brief: Do an additional dice of damage on attacks made from hiding.
Strike From the Shadows.verbose: Do an additional dice of damage on an attacks made from hiding.

Minor Spell of Distraction.brief: Offhand. Create a loud noise or bright light. Enemy must make a SP save or lose an action and have the next attack against them at advantage.
Minor Spell of Distraction.verbose: As an offhand action, you may use magic to create a minor ruckus within 100 feet of yourself. This might include a loud sound or bright light. When used in combat, the enemy must make an inner fire save against your spell power or lose an action on their next turn and have the next attack against them made at advantage.

Spell of Darkvision.verbose: As an Offhand Action, you may use minor magic to give yourself darkvision for one hour.

Meat Shield.brief: Attack Reaction. Contested DEX check against adjacent enemy. Success, they are hit instead of you.
Meat Shield.verbose: As a reaction when you are attacked, role a contested DEX check against an adjacent enemy of up to one size larger than yourself. On success, you may avoid the attack by pulling them into its way.

Flow with the Battle.brief: Move through spaces occupied by enemies at a 10ft. of movement penalty. Still exposed.
Flow with the Battle.verbose: Move through spaces occupied by enemies at a cost of 10 feet of movement. You still leave yourself exposed as you do this.

Draining Strike.brief: Regain half of the damage you deal as health.
Draining Strike.verbose: Sap an enemies spirit with an attack. Regain half of the damage as health.

Poison Creation.brief: During a rest, create a vial of poison which either adds a dice of damage to a blade, slows an enemy to 1/2 movement, or SP save or disadvantage on attacks.
Poison Creation.verbose: During a rest, you are able to create a vial of poison which may have one of the following effects: add a dice of damage to a blade, slow an enemy to half movement, give an enemy disadvantage on its attacks for 1 turn if it fails an inner fire save against your spell power. You may stockpile at most 2 vials of poison.

Vicious Critical.brief: On a crit, do an additional dice of damage.
Vicious Critical.verbose: On a critical hit, do an extra dice of damage.

Minor Spell of Invisibility.brief: Offhand. Become invisible for 5 minutes or 2 turns.
Minor Spell of Invisibility.verbose: As an Offhand Action, you may use minor magic to make yourself invisible for 5 minutes or 3 turns.

High Ground.brief: You have advantage on plunging attacks
High Ground.verbose: You have advantage on plunging attacks.

Spell of Nimbleness.brief: Offhand. Targeted ranged attacks take disadv against you for 1hr. or 1 battle.
Spell of Nimbleness.verbose: As an offhand action, cast a spell which makes you even nimbler, giving targeted ranged attacks take disadvantage against you for one hour or 1 battle.

Throw Caution to the Wind.brief: +1 damage dice to all attacks for a turn, but enemy attacks get advantage.
Throw Caution to the Wind.verbose: On your turn, optionally add an extra damage dice to all of your attacks, but all enemy attacks get advantage on you for a turn.

Spell of True Sight.brief: Offhand. See invisible things and have darkvision for 1 hour.
Spell of True Sight.verbose: As an Offhand Action, use magic to grant yourself the effects of darkvision and may also see invisible objects and entities for one hour.

Imposter.verbose: Gain 1d6 on any checks made to imitate someone.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Line Them Up.brief: If you slay an enemy, gain another attack and 10ft. of movement.
Line Them Up.verbose: If you slay an enemy, gain another attack action and 10 feet of movement.

Thick Headed.brief: You have advantage when enemies try to break into your mind.
Thick Headed.verbose: You have advantage on any checks involving an enemy breaking into your mind or dominating you.

Greater Spell of Invisibility.brief: Offhand. Become invisible for 1 hour or 1 battle.
Greater Spell of Invisibility.verbose: As an Offhand Action, you may use minor magic to make yourself invisible for 1 hour.

Greater Flow with the Battle.brief: No movement penalty for moving through enemy spaces.
Greater Flow with the Battle.verbose: Passing through enemy spaces no longer results in a movement penalty.

Corner.brief: Reaction. If an enemy moves to pass 15 feet of you to either side, move to block them.
Corner.verbose: If an enemy moves to pass you within 15 feet to either side, you may move to block them.

Greater Poison Creation.brief: Create 2 vials of poison during a rest, stockpile 4.
Greater Poison Creation.verbose: You can now create 2 vials of poison during a rest, and may stockpile 4.

Assassinate.brief: 2 additional dice of damage on attacks made from hiding.
Assassinate.verbose: Do two dice of damage on attacks made from hiding. Replaces Strike from the Shadows.

Greater Spell of Distraction.brief: Offhand. Create a loud noise or bright light. Enemy must make a SP save or lose an action.
Greater Spell of Distraction.verbose: As an offhand action, you may use magic to create a large distraction within 100 feet of yourself. This can include a moderately sized illusion, very loud noise or bright light, or the sound of someone's voice that you have heard. When in combat, all enemies within 30 feet of your target must make an spell power saving throw or loose an action on their next turn and have the next attack against them be made at advantage.

Radiant Invisibility Break.brief: Create a distraction equivalent to Minor Spell of Distraction when you break invisibility.
Radiant Invisibility Break.verbose: Create a distraction equivalent to Minor Spell of Distraction when you break invisibility.

Reduced Critical.verbose: Decrease your critical hit target by 1.

Cleric.description: After pledging their allegiance to their deity, Clerics have made it their duty to follow their will. Clerics are weak, and do not fight with physical magic. Spell Choice.verbose: At the start of your journey, you know 2 extra tier zero spells.

Learn Spells.brief: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier you have access to.
Learn Spells.verbose: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier that you have access to. Spells must be learned from one of your spellbooks.

Tier Zero Spells.verbose: You have achieved a basic knowledge of the arcane, and may now learn tier zero spells from any of your spellbooks.

Learning Spells.brief: You can learn new spells from spellbooks or when you level up.
Learning Spells.verbose: New spells or techniques are obtained by leveling up or by finding spellbooks or scrolls in the world. A spellbook may contain a specific spell, or a maximum spell tier. Spellbooks with a maximum spell tier contain one spell of your choice from the spellbooks that you can learn from with a tier up to the spellbook's maximum spell tier.

Novice Spellbook.brief: You have access to the Novice spellbook.
Novice Spellbook.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Novice Spellbook.

The Wizard's Addendum.brief: You have access to the Wizard's Addendum.
The Wizard's Addendum.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Wizard's Addendum.

Tier One Spells.verbose: Your powers are growing. You may now learn tier one spells from any of your spellbooks.

Looming Presence.brief: Gain advantage when intimidating entities with lower INT.
Looming Presence.verbose: Gain advantage when attempting to intimidate anything of lower intelligence than yourself.

Minor Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 0 spell as an offhand.
Minor Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier zero spell as an offhand action.

Tier Two Spells.verbose: You have graduated from novice to proficient! You may now learn tier two spells from any of your spellbooks.

Greater Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 1 spell as an offhand.
Greater Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier one spell as an offhand action.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Tier Three Spells.verbose: Magical energy flows through you. You may now learn tier three spells from any of your spellbooks.

Commit to Memory.brief: 1/day at the beginning, declare a tier 2 or greater spell to have -1 cost.
Commit to Memory.verbose: At the beginning of a day, you may commit one spell to memory of tier. For the remainder of the day, that spell costs 1 fewer action points.

Major Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 2 spell as an offhand.
Major Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier two spell as an offhand action.

Tier Four Spells.verbose: You are a master of your spellcraft. You can now learn tier four spells from any of your spellbooks.

Spell Invention.brief: You can invent your own spells. Attempt once per sleep.
Spell Invention.verbose: You are advanced enough in magic that you may begin inventing your own spells. To invent a spell, you must have either encountered something like it, or have a jumping off point in your spellbook. It can take long periods of time to craft a spell, and its success and cost will be determined by multiple rolls and saving throws, depending on complexity.

Tier Five Spells.verbose: You have achieved the highest form of sorcery, and are a mage to be reckoned with. You can now learn tier five spells from any of your spellbooks.

Tome of the Ancients.brief: You have access to the Tome of the Ancients.
Tome of the Ancients.verbose: You are now able to learn spells from the tome of the ancients.

Wizard.standings: Wizards are known to be friends to all races, and get along particularly well with Halflings and Rangers.

Longbow.verbose: You begin your journey with a d6 longbow.

Boot Knife.verbose: You carry a hidden d6 knife in your boot.

Archer.description: Some of the best marksmen in the world, archers are naturals with ranged weapons. They are often attached to their bow, and carry it with them everywhere. Archers come from all walks of life; some compete in tournaments, others are hunters and farmer's sons. Still others have served in the military. Archers should stay off of the front line, instead picking off foes from a distance.

Ranged Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use bows and throwing weapons without disadvantage.
Ranged Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use bows, throwing weapons, and simple projectile weapons without disadvantage.

Fletcher.brief: You craft your own normal arrows.
Fletcher.verbose: You know how to craft your own arrows, and always seem to have some on hand.

Net Arrows.brief: SP save or grappled. Each turn, STR SP save.
Net Arrows.verbose: You can now craft net arrows. When a net arrow hits its target, they must make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, they are instantly wrapped in a net, and are considered restrained. Each turn, they may make a strength saving throw against your spell power to attempt to break out of the net.

Huntsman.brief: You have advantage when attacking beasts.
Huntsman.verbose: You have advantage when attacking beasts.

Dual Shot.brief: Fire 2 arrows in a single attack. For standard arrows, adds a dice of damage.
Dual Shot.verbose: Fire two arrows at the same target in a single attack. With standard arrows, this effectively adds a dice of damage.

Mantel.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity checks when climbing.

Smoke Arrows.verbose: You can now craft smoke arrows. When a smoke arrow hits the ground, it creates a smokescreen with a 30 foot radius.

Rope Arrows.brief: When a rope arrow hits, a rope springs from it to you. Size based contested STR check to stop from moving away.
Rope Arrows.verbose: You have mastered the art of crafting rope arrows using minor magic. As soon as a rope arrow hits its target, a rope instantly appears connecting the target to your hand. This can be used to climb, or to tether enemies. If an enemy is tethered, you may make a size based contested strength check to stop them from moving away from you.

Healing Arrows.brief: Fire an arrow at an ally and heal them for half its damage.
Healing Arrows.verbose: You can craft healing arrows. Fire a healing arrow at an ally to heal them for half of its damage.

Reflexes.brief: Reaction. 1/turn, reduce a projectile's damage by 1d20. If reduced to 0, catch.
Reflexes.verbose: Reaction, attempt to catch a projectile. Roll a d20, and reduce the projectile's damage by that amount. If reduced to zero, you catch the projectile.

Fire and Ice Arrows.brief: Additional dice of fire (repeat) or ice (push back in initiative) damage.
Fire and Ice Arrows.verbose: You have mastered the art of crafting fire and ice arrows, and can craft at most 2 per day. Fire arrows do an additional dice of fire damage and deal half as much burn damage to enemies that fail a saving throw against your spell power. Ice arrows deal an additional dice of ice damage, and cause an enemy to move backward 1d4 spaces in the initiative order of they fail a saving throw against your spell power.

Vampiric Arrows.brief: Extra dice of damage. Half of all damage returns as health.
Vampiric Arrows.verbose: You can now craft vampiric arrows. Vampiric arrows do an additional dice of damage to an entity. Half of all damage done by the vampiric returns to you as health.

Steady.verbose: Do not take disadvantage when being jostled about.

Explosive Arrows.verbose: After much experimentation, you have finally mastered the art of crafting explosive arrows. Explosive arrows do 4d10 damage to all enemies in a twenty foot radius.

Shadow and Light Arrows.brief: Additional dice of shadow (blind) or light (double vs undead) damage.
Shadow and Light Arrows.verbose: You have mastered the art of crafting shadow and light arrows. Shadow arrows do an additional dice of dark damage and cause enemies who fail an inner fire saving throw against your spell power to go blind until they make a spell power save. This save is repeated at the end of each of  their turns or once every ten minutes. Light arrows deal an additional dice of light damage, or twice as much to the undead.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Shock Arrows.verbose: You can now craft shock arrows. When a shock arrow hits an enemy, it deals an additional dice of shock damage. If an affected entity is wearing metal armor or is made of or standing in water, they take a second additional dice of damage. The affected entity must make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, they are knocked prone.

Greater Reflexes.brief: Reaction. If you catch an arrow, fire it back at the enemy.
Greater Reflexes.verbose: If you stop an arrow with reflexes, you may immediately make an attack with it.

Blink Arrows.brief: You can craft blink arrows, which teleport you to where they hit.
Blink Arrows.verbose: After learning more about magic, you have learned how to create blink arrows. Blink arrows instantly teleport you to the position that they hit.

Uncanny Perception.brief: You can see in pitch dark, have PER advantage, and role initiative with advantage.
Uncanny Perception.verbose: You have uncanny perception, which allows you to sense your way in total darkness, gives you advantage on all perception checks, and let you role initiative with advantage.

True Mastery.brief: Every ranged weapon is at least 1d12 to you.
True Mastery.verbose: Every ranged weapon functions as at least a d12 weapon in your hands.

Expert Fletcher.verbose: All arrows now cost 1 action point less.

Delayed Explosive Arrows.brief: Fire an explosive arrow which detonates when you say a command word.
Delayed Explosive Arrows.verbose: Fire an explosive arrow which detonates when you speak a command word.

Volley.brief: Attack all enemies you can see in one action.
Volley.verbose: Attack every enemy you can see in a single action.

Anti-Gravity Arrows.brief: SP save or gravity is reversed for them. Lasts 1 min, 1d4 turns, or till save.
Anti-Gravity Arrows.verbose: You can now craft Anti-Gravity arrows. When an Anti-Gravity arrow hits its target, they must make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, gravity is reversed for them, and they fly towards the sky. Anti-gravity arrows last for one minute, 1d4 turns, or until the entity succeeds its spell power saving throw.

Firestorm Arrows.brief: After 1 turn, 15 ft. diameter. pillar of flame for 3 turns. 4d10 dmg.
Firestorm Arrows.verbose: You can now craft firestorm arrows. A firestorm arrow does nothing for one turn or one minute after it strikes something. Then, it explodes into a massive pillar of flame with a fifteen foot diameter. All entities caught in the pillar of flame take 8d10 damage instantly. The pillar of flame stays for 3 turns.

Marksman.description: Through luck, valor, or perhaps trickery, the Gunslinger has managed to acquire one of the rarest weapons in the world. As such, they have a close bond with their gun, which is usually their primary means of income. At the beginning of their adventure, a gunsling may choose to start with either a rifle or a pistol, a decision that determines engagement range and their upgrade path.

Proficient With Firearms.brief: You don't take disadvantage when using firearms.
Proficient With Firearms.verbose: You are able to use firearms without disadvantage.

Firearm Creation and Modification.brief: You can attempt to create and modify firearms.
Firearm Creation and Modification.verbose: You are able to create and modify your firearms as detailed in the rulebook.

This is my Weapon.brief: Don't forget to name your gun.
This is my Weapon.verbose: Your gun is the only friend you need. Make sure to give it a name.

Natural Intellect.verbose: You have a natural intelligence which grants you advantage on intelligence checks.

Rifle.verbose: You begin your adventure with a rifle.

Called Shot.brief: Extra damage dice. SP save or drop weapon, fall 50 feet if flying, be blinded, or be knocked prone.
Called Shot.verbose: Aim for a specific part of an enemy. Add an extra damage dice. The enemy must make a spell power save or drop a weapon, be blinded, drop 50 feet if flying, or be knocked prone.

Strike From the Shadows.brief: Do an additional dice of damage on attacks made from hiding.
Strike From the Shadows.verbose: Do an additional dice of damage on an attacks made from hiding.

Disappear.brief: Offhand. Attempt to hide. Must be out of sight and out of mind.
Disappear.verbose: Use an offhand action to attempt to hide. You must be out of line of sight of enemies and not where they would reasonably expect you to be.

Focus.brief: Gain advantage on a shot. Negates distance checks.
Focus.verbose: Focus before a shot to gain advantage on it. Removes distance penalties.

Harrying Critical.brief: On a crit, enemy is harried for 1 turn and disadvantage on their next action.
Harrying Critical.verbose: On a critical hit, the attacked entity is considered harried and must make its next action with disadvantage.

Bull Rush.brief: Rush forward at 10 ft, may end in melee attack w/ extra dmg dice. SP save or fall prone.
Bull Rush.verbose: Spend 1 action point to rush forward 10 feet. This rush may end in a melee attack which does an additional dice of damage to your target. The target must win at a contested strength check or fall prone.

Tracer Round.brief: Additional dice of fire damage, next attack against enemy is with advantage.
Tracer Round.verbose: Fire a bright tracer round to gage the exact distance to an enemy. Add a dice of fire damage to the attack and give the next attack made against the enemy advantage.

Steady.verbose: Do not take disadvantage when being jostled about.

Vicious Critical.brief: On a crit, do an additional dice of damage.
Vicious Critical.verbose: On a critical hit, do an extra dice of damage.

Forceful Shot.brief: Additional dice of damage. SP save or pushed back 15 feet.
Forceful Shot.verbose: Fire a shot which carries force behind it. Add an additional dice of damage and force the enemy to make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, they are pushed back fifteen feet.

Line Them Up.brief: If you slay an enemy, gain another attack and 10ft. of movement.
Line Them Up.verbose: If you slay an enemy, gain another attack action and 10 feet of movement.

Elemental Strike.brief: Free Action. Convert your damage to a different type for 1 turn.
Elemental Strike.verbose: Convert your damage to a different type as a free action.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Reduced Critical.verbose: Decrease your critical hit target by 1.

Armor Penetrating Rounds.brief: Your shots are unaffected by armor and pass through 1ft of stone or 1 enemy.
Armor Penetrating Rounds.verbose: Your shots now pass through up to 1 foot of stone or 1 enemey and are unaffected by armor.

Warrior Spirit.brief: Gain 1 AP when you kill an enemy.
Warrior Spirit.verbose: If you slay an enemy, regain one action point.

Greater Bull Rush.brief: Bull rush now carries you 20 feet.
Greater Bull Rush.verbose: Bull rush now carries you 20 feet.

Greater Firearm Creation and Modificatio.brief: You have advantage when creating or modifying firearms and can use advanced designs.
Greater Firearm Creation and Modificatio.verbose: You have advantage on checks used to create and modify firearms, and have access to advanced firearm designs.

Assassinate.brief: 2 additional dice of damage on attacks made from hiding.
Assassinate.verbose: Do two dice of damage on attacks made from hiding. Replaces Strike from the Shadows.

Set Up.brief: Spend five minutes or 1 round of combat to ensure that your next shot is a crit.
Set Up.verbose: Take five minutes or 1 round of combat to guarantee that your next shot is a critical hit.

Called Critical.brief: On crit, apply a called shot effect to the enemy.
Called Critical.verbose: On critical hit, immediately apply one of the effects from called shot to the enemy. If the critical is on a called shot, apply a second effect.

Greater Armor Penetrating Rounds.brief: Your shots can pass through up to 3 enemies.
Greater Armor Penetrating Rounds.verbose: Your shots now pass up to three enemies.

Greater Elemental Strike.brief: No cost to convert damage type.
Greater Elemental Strike.verbose: There is no longer a cost associated with converting your damage type.

Greater Line Them Up.brief: On crit, gain another attack and 10ft. of movement.
Greater Line Them Up.verbose: When you score a critical hit on an enemy, gain another attack action and 10 feet of movement.
